page.title: 01Chiddingstone Hoath
page.content: Area comprised of wooded hills and valleys sloping down to the R Eden in NE corner & the R Medway in the SE. The rivers rise on Ashdown forest & flood quickly after heavy rain.The slopes are woodland & grass for cattle & sheep on shallow topsoil over sandstone. Two slopes support a succesful vineyard. There are outcrops of sandstone on the wooded hills. Plantations of sweet chestnut & conifers were until recently owned by the Hever estate & maintained for pheasant rearing for shooting. Now becoming over grown they are increasingly overrun by vermin. There are many well used footpaths. Old timber framed houses with tile hanging over wattle & daub are dotted throughout the area which is designated of outstanding natural beauty.
